choices.text:
the wind of change that knocked down avertible dictatorship, albeit a civilian dictatorship in 1999. Overindulgence contributed to the reason Nigeria is still groping in the hell that political dispensation suggested let alone realising it had offloaded the yoke of dictatorship. Rather than march on to free themselves from avoidable demand for accountability by Nigerians, political actors risked their destiny to dictatorship in the form of presidential democracy suggested by NNAMDI AZIKIWE and his cohorts. The prophets of doom were circumstantial in their unmeasured appetite for power. Disrespect for traditional norms and values further frustrated their desire for greater values that Nigeria beckoned for since Independence. The greedy dudes lectured and schooled on how to dismantle cultural values and traditional heritage in preference for average European system of government to enable them shun accountability to anybody, most importantly the citizens. The blueprint that was misunderstood put constitutional democracy on trial in Nigeria, resulting to tolerance of bloodbath and double standard to governmental functions that the avowed constitutional responsibility would not allow. Whilst the driven intolerance for autocracy abated in early 80s, one would have thought that a government under a civilian racketeer would have tilted its tolerance to constitutional understanding. Alas, the opposite of constitutionalism was in trend-setting display both in handling responsibilities of government and constructing misrepresentation of power learner with immunity; even though it was Liberty that was in vogue.

It was misrepresentation by executive to usurp the power
